import React from 'react' class Users extends React.Component{ constructor(props){ super(props) this.state = { allUsers: [], addUser : { name: '', id : 0 } } this.getAllUsers = this.getAllUsers.bind(this) this.handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this) this.handleAddUser = this.handleAddUser.bind(this) this.getUser = this.getUser.bind(this) window.onload = this.getAllUsers; } getAllUsers() { //Logic to fetch data from the users table fetch('http://localhost:8080/api/users').then(res => res.json()).then(result => { this.setState({ allUsers: result }) }).catch(console.log) } handleChange(e) { this.setState({addUser:{ name: e.target.value }}) } handleAddUser() { fetch('http://localhost:8080/api/users/addUser', { method : 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(this.state.addUser) }).then(this.setState({ addUser: { name: '' } })) } getUser(e, id) { fetch('http://localhost:8080/api/users' + id).then(res => res.json()).then(result => { this.setState({ addUser: { name: result[0].name, id : result[0].id } }) }) } render(){ return(
